core.userGoalStatement: As a CEO, I am committed to driving sustainable growth, navigating economic uncertainty, and fostering innovation. My role is to mobilize the organization for long-term value creation while delivering short-term performance.
core.coreBelief: Sustainable success comes from balancing near-term results with bold, long-term investments—especially in technology, talent, and ESG.
core.contentImplication: Frame all content around the CEO’s dual mandate of near-term results and future-proofing, surfacing data that affirms this balance.

items.Description: Define and execute strategies that expand revenue, margin, and market share.
Champion AI-led innovation and ensure the organisation extracts measurable value from emerging tech.
Safeguard resilience across supply chains, cost structures, and geopolitical risks.
Shape an inclusive, high-performance culture that attracts, engages, and retains top talent.
Align boards, investors, employees, and society behind the enterprise mission.

responsibilities.contentImplication: Tie every asset to at least one responsibility to remain top-of-mind and high-value to CEOs.

items: Strategic growth planning
Digital transformation & AI
Operational & supply-chain excellence
Workforce engagement & leadership development
ESG integration & CSR
Financial performance & enterprise risk
knowledge.contentImplication: Demonstrate Korn Ferry authority by anchoring insights in one or more of these domains.

items.Finding: 71% of CEOs expect to leverage AI effectively, but only 47% of employees agree (24-pt gap).
items.Leverage_Point: Present AI programs that pair C-suite vision with workforce-level enablement.

items.Finding: 83% of CEOs say CSR commitment is 'just right' vs. 47% of ICs (36-pt gap).
items.Leverage_Point: Use transparent metrics and employee co-creation to turn ESG into a trust accelerator.

items.Finding: 74% of CEOs feel able to ‘switch off’ vs. 59% of ICs (15-pt gap).
items.Leverage_Point: Show evidence-based tactics that protect well-being without hurting performance.

items.Finding: CEOs value environmental sustainability 15 % more than peers when evaluating roles.
items.Leverage_Point: Position sustainability initiatives as revenue drivers, not mere compliance.

connectionOpportunities.contentImplication: Lead with these quantified disconnects to spark instant relevance and dialogue.

items: Achieving durable, above-market growth

motivations.contentImplication: Explicitly link your solution’s benefits to these motivational levers.

items.Description: Blueprints for revenue expansion that address the 34-pt gap in perceived tech-experimentation encouragement (78 % CEOs vs 44 % ICs).
Scalable learning paths to close the 38-pt gap in AI skill confidence (73 % CEOs vs 35 % ICs).

needs.contentImplication: Address one or more of these survey-backed needs in every offer or insight.

items.Gap: 24-pt optimism gap on AI leverage and 38-pt training confidence gap.
items.Business_Impact: Slows ROI on tech investments; fuels change fatigue.
items.Opportunity: Provide inclusive upskilling and quick-win pilots that validate AI value.

items.Gap: 36-pt gap on CSR commitment and 33-pt gap on culture perception.
items.Business_Impact: Erodes trust and hampers engagement; reputational risk.
items.Opportunity: Deploy transparent reporting and employee-voice programs to align narrative with reality.

items.Gap: CEO over-weights job security (+2 %) and culture importance (+6 %) vs. employees.
items.Business_Impact: Retention levers may miss actual employee priorities.
items.Opportunity: Probe broader engagement drivers when designing talent strategy.

items.Business_Impact: Risk of mixed messages on availability and flexibility.
items.Opportunity: Set explicit boundary norms that respect both business and employee needs.
